nodes.text: You make it sound as if this trap disarming is no big deal.
Once you understand how it works, it's not all that difficult with these simple traps. I imagine that the more complex traps will be very challenging.
Don't forget.. more complex traps will be more dangerous.
And painful!
True, but again, I try to focus on solving the puzzle. If I think about making mistakes, I'm sure to make one.
I don't have anything else to say to Thomas right now.
How come you're here by yourself? I thought this was an assignment. I expected everyone to be here.
I overheard Katie and Esme talking about going to the store to buy a set of lockpicks.
And of course Mr. "More Rogue than thou" Sosi figures he's too good at everything to need any practice.
I think it's more likely that Mr. Kyro is the expert.
So how are things going for you?
Rather well, thanks.
I've been helping Esme overcome her reading difficulties with the Master's way of speaking and handwriting.
I can understand why she has problems understanding the Master's test questions. I have trouble understanding them!
The Master doesn't make it easy for any of us.
You seem to take our 'Disbarred Bard' lessons so seriously, always doing exactly what the Master asks. It doesn't seem very Roguish of you.
But... wouldn't the Master get angry if we don't do what he wants us to do?
He's a Rogue too, isn't he? I'm not sure he wants us to be good, obedient little children.
You may be right...
What did you think of Sosi's brag in class?
Sosi goes out of his way to ingratiate himself with the Master. I'm not sure though that he's getting away with it.
You mean that von Urwald can see through Sosi, too?
From the way the Master looks whenever Sosi speaks up in class, I think that the Master knows that Sosi is a two-faced sycophant.
Then I can't wait for the day when the Master shows Sosi exactly how the Master really feels about Sosi.
Do you understand how lockpicks work?
I've studied the "Beginner's Guide to Lockpicks" and it seems straightforward enough. I just need to practice to teach my hands how to put that knowledge to use.
I don't suppose I could borrow your copy of the book for a bit?
I'm sorry, I'm using the book right now to learn pick positions. Perhaps you could use the copy in the Library...
Yeah, I guess I could do that.
Have fun with your lock practice.
You too.
A question for you - the other night when you caught the school thief in the act - Why did you let him go? He stole a lot of things. Don't you think he should be punished for his crimes?
He returned everything after I talked to him. It's not like he actually stole the items; he just borrowed them.
Poor Thomas, you seem more like a Rogue every day.
So what skills did your parents think were essential learning when you were growing up?
My mother made sure I learned all the social skills like dancing and etiquette. My father made sure I learned everything else.
Isn't your father a Paladin?
He was a Paladin, yes. He passed away several years ago.

options.text: Ask About the Rope and Grapnel

nodes.text: I'm surprised to see you here. I thought you'd be in the Practice room working on your rope and grapnel skills.
I wanted to practice my lock picking skills before tomorrow's test.
I'll practice my grapnel skills later.
You shouldn't practice alone. If you throw a grapnel as well as you throw a dagger, you're likely to hit yourself on the head with it.
Thomas may surprise you, Katie. He gets better and better at throwing every day.
<smile>
He probably won't hit himself with the grapnel more than three or four times now.
(grin)
<rolls eyes>
Then again, Katie, would you really want to be in the room when Thomas is practicing his grapnel throwing? You're just as likely to get hit as he is.
(grin)
(sigh)

options.text: Say Something Humorous to Lighten the Mood

nodes.text: The Master made using the grapnel look easy, but I'm willing to bet that we'll all wind up black and blue from practicing that skill.
I'm willing to take that risk. It's better than being laughed at.
Haven't you mastered your lockpicking skills yet?
I don't really think that tomorrow's test will be a problem...
(sigh) I suppose I'm just putting off learning how to use a grapnel.
Don't worry - you aren't the only one. I'm sure that we all would rather be here than hitting ourselves repeatedly with grapnels.
Good luck on the test tomorrow.
You too, Shawn.
